Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: Children are about to finish school, and the parent should pick them up
Situation2: They share only one open evening before a busy travel week.
Story: I glanced at the clock, feeling my heart race. It was almost three, and I knew the kids would be waiting for me at the school gate, eyes searching the crowd for my face. I’d promised them I’d be there, just like every other Friday, to hear about their week and maybe stop for ice cream on the way home. But tonight was different. My boyfriend had been looking forward to this evening all week—our only chance to be together before he left for his business trip. He’d made dinner reservations at my favorite place, even picked out a movie he knew I’d love. I could hear his voice in my head, “I just want us to have this night.” I wanted that too, but the thought of my kids waiting, feeling forgotten, twisted my stomach. I stood in the hallway, keys in hand, torn between two worlds, both needing me, both expecting me, and I didn’t know how to choose.
